reviews.title: BMO Field is a great place to watch a soccer match and it's extremely easy to get to via public transit.
text: I went to BMO Field for the match between NYCFC and Toronto FC.  The stadium was really easy to get to, with the tram dropping you off about 2 blocks from the entrance.  The seats on the sideline are well covered.  It rained non stop for the entire match, but everyone in my group was completely dry throughout.  The concessions and bathroom were easily accessible and clean.  My beer was much cheaper than I'm used to in the USA.  Thanks BMO Field for a 5 star Soccer viewing experience!

reviews.title: Awful set up
text: Don't turn up early! There's nothing around this stadium in terms of food or entertainment, shops etc and they let you in less then an hour before the match- so there's thousands of people queuing around the car park!
Very small pitch and stadium and limited food choices. Very tight and not much space. Atmosphere was ok but football was more like uk lower league. Nice experience but could have been much better!

reviews.title: Football Game - Awesome Vibes!
text: -Outstanding atmosphere for two New Zealander's to experience
-It was easy to navigate in the stadium and we both loved the atmosphere!

reviews.title: Great night out watching Argonauts!
text: Went to the Toronto Argonauts game last night against the BC Lions. The night was cool and crisp. Perfect night to watch football.
Really enjoyed the facility for the first time being there, helped that Toronto won the game.
I think there was about 18,000 people very lively. Lots of fun.
Parking app wasn‚Äôt the easiest to set up. Just some feedback.

reviews.title: Football (soccer) Stadium - Location, Location, Location!!!
text: Getting a ‚Äúfree‚Äù ticket for a seat related to my Atlanta United FC season tickets, did not allow me to choose the seat.  Consequently I was on the last row (highest) on the second level.  It was a very long walk up a lot of steps.  Not for the faint hearted.  The view of the field was good, but related to the position I was in, it was difficult to see the big screen to see close ups of the action.  I would not pay for that seat for a future match.  The atmosphere was very good however, food choices were fair, but expensive - although all stadium food is expensive related to what I am used to in my home stadium in Atlanta.  Service was quick, lines not too long at all.  Unusual way to enter the stadium, that even after going through security was still behind a closed gate for a while.  Location is absolutely perfect.  Beautiful view right on the water‚Äôs front.  Great park and walking area just across from the stadium if you have spare time when going to an event.

reviews.title: Great Staff!
text: We mostly do concerts here but the sports venue is good too. Excellent handicap seating and lots of good places to grab food and beverage of choice,  When it is full it is really really loud so you might consider ear phones or plugs,
P:arking is a bit of a challenge so see if there is somewhere ck to park and take a cob over,

reviews.title: Pretty average
text: Just a simple round Stadium with a few food stands. The seats aren't the most comfortable, felt like bleacher seats. It was hard to see the score board depending on your seats.

reviews.title: Only half made it in by start and staff inadequate and uncaring
text: Lines hundreds of meters long - some pushed in in 15 or 20 min others took more than 90 minutes. Many only got in at half time
Security tried to expedite but MSLE ticket checkers help people up and were uncaring

reviews.title: Good venue
text: Great arena,  pricey drinks as usual at any sporting event,  clean environment,  had some nice kids game giveaway thingies,  pretty big place

reviews.title: Nice Venue, Sit on the West Side
text: We went as a family to see TFC play for the first time for their finale against the Columbus Crew. The seats we got were situated right in the corner, a few rows up, on the east side. As an evening game, the sun was setting and it was right in our eyes for a lot of the first half - therefore, sit on the west side!

The atmosphere was great. Toronto has a great supporters section and some amazing camaraderie and atmosphere.The food was as expected, expensive stadium food, so, nothing out of the ordinary. The stadium doesn't feel huge, so there aren't really any bad seats. My kids got a kick out of seeing all of the airplanes taking off from Toronto Billy Bishop Airport.
BMO Field was accessible by both GO Train and by the TTC streetcars. There were ample streetcars waiting after the game to take everyone to Union Station and home from there.

reviews.title: Tons of fun
text: For anyone that hasn't been to one or isn't a soccer fun you will have fun the crowd atmosphere is phenomenal especially if you like to drink tons of chants a big party none the less it is Toronto pricing meaning the drinks and food are expensive but it is a fun trip a few times a year

reviews.title: No Bad Seats
text: Do they do other events aside from Toronto FC here? I hope so because it's a great venue. I had a great time here. The food was good, and I like the other vendors they have setting up shop. Plus, the energy of the spectators was like I've never seen before! I can't wait to go back.

reviews.title: Soccer Stadium with Some Views
text: BMO Field is the soccer stadium for Toronto FC and is located within the exhibition area of Toronto on Lake Ontario. The stadium is also used for CFL games too. The sight lines in the stadium are pretty good and the views of the city in the background as well. Ticket prices are moderately priced for Toronto and sometimes getting resale tickets can save you some money on them. Basically depends on the game. Overall, BMO Field is a nice soccer venue to go see a game.

reviews.title: The Home of Toronto FC
text: I have been to a few other MLS venues and love BMO Field. The food is better than most and the only places that can compare to the atmosphere are Portland and LAFC.

reviews.title: Would give it 0/5 if I could
text: I am in a cast due to a broken ankle and had to make use of the elevators. Next to me in line was another person who had a cast next to me waiting for the lift. I waited 4 rides for room on one as they were full of abled bodied people who did not need to use them. Those in the elevator refused to get off for myself and the other person.

The stadium hires an elevator attendant on each one to push the buttons, yet neither of the employees forced those out for people who actually needed to use them. Had there not been employees on the elevators I would write a better review for the stadium. It was disrespectful of the people, but absolutely unacceptable of the staff to not let those of us to who required the lift to not have access to it.
We waited so long that the other person hopped up the stairs on one foot, and I missed a few minutes of the game due to how slowly I had to walk up the 4 flights of stairs.

reviews.title: No rain, not sleet...
text: The stadium is quite impressive after the recent renovations and you can sit mostly dry under the huge metal awnings. What did not change is the exposure to the blistering wind that makes watching many games an exercise in bravery (or stupidity). So it was on a very cold and snowy mid April night. Little solace was provided by the expensive food that caused huge masses to crowd thee areas outside the seating and making almost impossible to go everywhere the flow would not take you

reviews.title: First Game Night with the Hubby
text: It was our first time watching a game at BMO Field in Toronto but it was a GREAT one. The music, the fireworks and the vibe that runs through the stadium is amazing. It all sets a great mood for the game. Although it was cold if you were bundled up lkke me and my husband were it was still a great experience. We had a great time, there were many options as to where to buy beer and there were a few places for snacks. The stadium was cleans and the fans were great. All in all I could at we will be back again soon. We loved the seating. It was almost a full house but I felt that brought the game to life. It's a must see for soccer lover's

reviews.title: The coldest ground Ive ever been too !
text: I am üíØ% sure this is a lovely stadium to visit when the suns out and shining
But why why why have a stadium by a lake thats open on all sides and play evening games when its soooooooooooo cold

Ive watched plenty of games throughout the UK and Europe and can honestly say Ive never been as cold as the TFC game vs Real Salt Lake. I was expecting it to be cold and dressed accordingly but to no avail . . . Be warned !
Minus Points
Very expensive beer and food in ground
Ticket Office weren‚Äôt  particularly helpful
Port a loos outside the ground were an absolute disgrace !

reviews.title: Amateur Hour
text: I went to my first MSL game at BMO field with three friends, including a fanatic soccer fan visiting from Russia.  I had heard very good things about the atmosphere at BMO field, and I wanted to show off to my friend North America‚Äôs best soccer team.  We drove down from Ottawa and got four seats in the supporters section from my cousin who has had season tickets from the beginning.  We got to the game 1/2 hour before the start, but two of the tickets wouldn‚Äôt scan and we were told to go to the box office.  We waited there for 45 minutes, and then were told two of the seats had already entered so were null and void.  It seemed dozens of others were also having the same problem.  My cousin attested they were his personal tickets and had not been resold or sent to anybody else.  He then texted his buddies in the stadium who replied that all the seats were still empty.  Nevertheless, they would not let us in, so we had to buy two more seats (in another section from the originals).  When we finally scanned in, we found people sitting in our just purchased seats who had the same seat numbers.  We showed an usher our tickets who said he didn‚Äôt know what happened but we couldn‚Äôt sit there.   We then tried to go to our original seats, but by this time someone was sitting in them who claimed they belonged to ‚Äúhis boys,‚Äù although he acknowledged that he did not have a ticket for the seats.  When I went to show him my etickets, my phone battery died so I no longer had proof of having any seats at all (the box office had taken our paper tickets). Another usher came and asked to see our tickets which I could no longer show, and then he wanted to escort us out of the building because we had no tickets. My friend then called my cousin who convinced the usher that we were there legit.  We were then seated in random seats (two and two) only to have another person without a ticket for the seats show up and claim the new seats belonged to his friend.  Eventually we found another two empty seats in the back row with 4 minutes left in the first half.  Whole thing was a total nightmare, although my Russian friend found the whole thing quite funny (and more entertaining than the actual game which TFC won 3-1.

reviews.title: Awesome Multi-Purpose Stadium by the Lake!
text: I've seen TFC play soccer, the Argos play football, Rugby Sevens, etc. here and each time I've been happy with my experience at BMO Field. It's got a lot of good restaurants, food stalls, etc. and the boxes are great with views of the field.

reviews.title: Beware the cold breeze
text: A very ‚Äúhot‚Äù field for the TfC players, but a recipe for hypothermia for the spectators, due to the proximity to the strong winds from the lake. The recent addition in seating capacity and rooftop has at least reduced most of the risk of being rained or snowed over. The concessions stands tends to become overcrowded quickly limiting mobility on the decks

reviews.title: Toronto FC
text: It was my first time seeing the Soccor team. The venue was well lit and fun to watch. We were in the Eastside suites. There was a common area with food, drinks and a bar. There were viewing counters and tables as well as access to the stands.
The crowds were enthusiastic. A disease lay going off at goaltime.

We attended during the exhibition fair. I forgot that was free admission to the fair at the time. We should have come earlier for two reasons. The first was parking, it was a nightmare. It took us 50 minutes to get a spot on the grounds because of traffic. The price was $35 inflated greatly during the ex. My friends went to a liberty village which was also packed.
The second reason is that we could have come during the morning or afternoon and experienced the fair before the evening soccor game.
I would have rated the actual game an venue a four if it wasn‚Äôt for the parking.

reviews.title: TFC campeones cup game
text: While in Toronto we wanted to either watch a TFC or blue jays game and it just happened that they were playing midweek and as we were all big football (sorry soccer!) fans we decided to take in TFC. The stadium is great and had good facilities another reviewer said these were poor but god help him if he went to an Everton FC game as that really would be an eye opener! We had fantastic seats with no obstructed views again unlike watching Everton but it was a great experience to see a game and be able to drink in the stands which sadly we are unable to do back home they even had a beer guy so you could buy while the match was going on the only disappointment was that TFC didnt win but the Mexican fans were friendly and it was great there was no segregation like in England. My sister in law bought a TFC shirt to go the match in but me and my brother could not bring ourselves to wear a red shirt due you our rivals on Merseyside playing in them! All in all it was a great night and we will all root for TFC now in the future and hopefully be back to see an MLS match in a full stadium.

reviews.title: Father and son night out
text: Friendly and helpful staff, nice people sitting around us, clean stadium, great night out with my teenager. We will defiantly go back for another soccer game.

reviews.title: Poor Design
text: Do not buy beer, water or any other liquid. We were in the South end zone. It was 300 ft. to the nearest men's washroom. At half time, the 6 urinal, 4 stall washroom had a line up for at least a 100 ft. Missed half of the third quarter of the football game.
Terrible foresight in design of the facility. HOwever, the number of beer taps probably far exceeded the number of stalls. Feel sorry for women if their facilities are comparable
Wake -up BMO! Put some money back into upgrading your facilities..

reviews.title: S√∫per fun experience
text: I‚Äôm a huge sports fan and one of my dreams is to visit as many famous stadiums & Arenas as I can.

BMO Field is located out downtown. But with very different ways to get there. Is you are using public transportation. Make sure to hit the lakeshore west line if you are coming from Union station or Lakeshore east if you are coming from west of the city! But also you can take the 509 at The Ttc station at Union station. Get off at the exhibition stop! Super fast and smooth! Around $6 bucks with the Go transit. $3.25 with TTC.
Incredible atmosphere
Very safe place
Food and beverage service is super fast
A lot of vendor on the concourse
Enough toilet service all over around
View from the stand is ridiculous beautiful
I Recommend those sport for after the gm
Rooftop hotel X
The Craft Liberty village

reviews.title: Overpriced tickets for poor view!
text: I asked my cousin to organise tickets for the game against Chicago as we where going to be in Canada at the end of July and beginning of August. He paid almost 300 dollars for the tickets and ticketmaster said the tickets would be released 24hrs before the game. Unfortunately the tickets where for behind the goals in a general admission area. These tickets are for a shockingly poor view that you have to be over 6ft to have a chance to see the game at all but totally unsuitable for children so we ended up trying to find a point that we could all see the game to no avail so we ended up going to the other end of the stadium so we could watch it on the big screen-the first time we have spent 300 bucks to watch a game on the television. We feel this is just a money making exercise by Toronto to sell tickets for an area  that is totally unsuitable for purpose. This is the only blip I have ever had in the numerous times myself and my family have visited the incredible country that is Cnada.

reviews.title: Fun Spot to catch a game
text: Visited for the first time and caught a TFC Game.  Great sightlines everywhere and relatively easy to get in and out of the stadium.  Didn't sit too close, but didn't feel to far away from the pitch.  Great family spot for either Gridiron or European Football....

reviews.title: TFC season seat holder - BMO field
text: Love this stadium and team. Have to experience the atmosphere and quality soccer finally in Canada. Last years final was awesome. Go Reds Go!

reviews.title: Great smaller stadium
text: First time to this stadium for a Argos game. I like it smaller and fun atmosphere. I know the football isn‚Äôt as good as NFL but it is entertaining and doesn‚Äôt  break the bank.

reviews.title: Lovely venue.
text: We went to this place to see a football game. Football is not my first love. The venue was lovely. The day was perfect and the breeze from the lake incredible. This is not a huge venue and I appreciated that. The access was fine and the food and drink plentiful if a little pricey. Beer comes to you . If you want a more potent beverage is is available with a small walk.

reviews.title: Great Facility
text: Went to see TFC versus Orlando City FC in August 2019. Even though we sat in the second deck, the seats were perfect. They do take some climbing to reach, but elevators are also available. If you like soccer, this is an excellent place to see a game. If you know little or nothing about soccer, this is an excellent place to learn something about it. Either way, you're going to have a good time here. The only negative really has nothing to do with BMO Field itself. There can be a phenomenal crush of people leaving after the game. If you want to go back to Liberty Village along Atlantic Avenue, there seems to be only one tunnel for foot passengers under the GO tracks. There can be so many people using it that it can be dangerous for the crush. Best to wait for the traffic to thin out.

reviews.title: TFC v Houston Dynamo
text: Anyone arriving into downtown Toronto from Pearson Airport will catch a glimpse of the BMO Field as they fly by on the expressway. The ground is about an hour on foot along the lake or 10 dollars in an uber from downtown. There's a fair amount of stadium fayre avaliable within the concourses where two cans of the locally brewed Mill Street will set you back 25 Canadian.

We were sat in the second tier opposite the main stand. The accent gives you great views of the downtown skyline a few miles away and once within your seats there's a fantastic view of the lake to your left, western Toronto ahead of you and of course the match below you.

Behind one of the the goals TFC supporters have formed a European style ultra section who generate a decent atmosphere with their drums, flares and pg rated chanting. The match was decent with the away side winning 3-1.

reviews.title: Terrific Sports Stadium
text: Even though Toronto lost to Houston, we enjoyed the soccer match. Because of a recent accident, I sat in the handicapped section of the stadium - great seats and wonderful, courteous support for the less than fully abled.
The worst part of the evening was trying to get home after the match. Ubers kept cancelling on us, and it was raining. We would have been better off using mass transit.

reviews.title: To see Toronto FC against Chicago with Sebastian Schweinsteiger.
text: Every seat in the stadium has good view. Foot is good but a bit expensive. Parking very convenient and reasonable priced

reviews.title: Great stadium
text: Went to the Toronto FC vs. Minnesota United game.  This was our first professional soccer game (we were visiting from MA.)  The stadium is great and the fans were awesome.  Getting into the stadium is a bit slow.  Only complaint is that the 200 level seats didn't have cup holders.

reviews.title: Worst professional stadium in North America
text: Countless issues with untrained security. Lousy security, lousy ushers, overpriced merch, food and beer. I gave up my season tickets after 9 years, and never spent a dime to support any MLSE team since.  I had a good laugh at their expansion and new "roof".  $200 million wasted.  Good riddance.

reviews.title: Nice atmosphere and sightlines.
text: A few min walk from the streetcar stop, great sight lines and overall fun experience for TFC Soccer.

reviews.title: Great stadium, even better fans!
text: Attended the Toronto vs Atlanta MLS match, which happily was a 4-1 win for TFC! Lovely stadium with great views no matter where you sit. Last game of the season which probably contributed to the awesome atmosphere.

reviews.title: Cool Stadium
text: Good location, Nice stadium and fun atmosphere. I enjoyed my time at the game and tickets are usually real cheap.
